newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: RULING CZECH PARTY WINS 36 PCT OF SENATE VOTE.
newsitem.headline: RULING CZECH PARTY WINS 36 PCT OF SENATE VOTE.

text.p: The Civic Democratic Party (ODS) of conservative Czech Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus won a commanding 36.47 percent of the national vote in the first round of Senate elections, the Central Election Commission said on Saturday.

The opposition Social Democrats came second with 20.27 percent in the polls, which operate under a British-style first past the post system rather than the proportional representation used for Czech lower house elections.
